授業目的: This course is an introduction to the field of communication. It is designed to help students develop a deeper understanding of cross-cultural communication by studying the theory and practice of how people communicate in diverse societies. In this course, students will work on improving their communication skills in person-to-person, small group, and public-speaking situations. Students will be given the opportunity to study theories and make cross-cultural comparisons, develop a repertoire of communication techniques and strategies by doing exercises and activities including writing, deliver oral presentations, and engage in small group discussions.
到達目標:
Students are expected to achieve the following goals:
1. To improve their understanding of communication;
2. To improve their ability to communicate in a variety of (intercultural) contexts;
3. To listen critically and objectively;
4. To participate in group discussions actively;
5. To present information, ideas and opinions in a coherent and organised way;
6. To develop media literacy; and,
7. To develop confidence when speaking in front of a group.
